website_summaries.verdict: Expensive, but it's durable, does a lot, and is great for situations where you can't access power wires directly.
pros: Very easy to use, large clamp, and can be used no contact if (for example) you can access the front of an outlet but can't access the power wires directly
cons: Seems a bit low for the money

customer_reviews.title: An ok meter
customer_reviews.text: I've used this meter for a while now. It does the job. it takes a couple of seconds to give the right reading, but it's ok. It's the right meter for the right price. It has everything I look for in a meter, even a temperature reading and it's the right size (Fits well in my hand). The voltage detector does not sound when near a power source, but sometimes that's a blessing, specially when the meter is close to a source and you're trying to check the voltage. I have another multimeter, but ever since I got this, it's the one I use most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with this meter
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this meter. Very easy to use with one hand. Price was very inexpensive given all the features. I put a label on inside of the clamp to show the direction for positive current flow.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great meter, all the settings I wanted in a meter!
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: The Pros Use It!
customer_reviews.text: As a journeyman electrician 14 years, my husband uses this tool all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Frances

customer_reviews.title: Far from accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it takes true RMS voltage reading, but the values I get when taking DC ampere are way off. For example, sometimes I get 5A when in reality it is less than 1A. I can't really recommend this product for the clamp / ampere readings, but everything else works fine.
customer_reviews.author: EdA

customer_reviews.title: Good Clamp.
customer_reviews.text: Good Clamp, good price, ecxellent quality, equal to a fluke clamp meter. many functions and very good price I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: before you buy it, think hard about how you will use it.
customer_reviews.text: As an electrician, the fact that it defaults to DC voltage and I have to change the mode to get it to read AC really stinks. Other meters automatically detect AC or DC and announce which is present on the display.
customer_reviews.author: Poe

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: This product has already stopped working and I am not allowed to return it. It was used infrequently and now that I have had it for just over two months, Amazon says it can not be returned. Piece of junk. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Y

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Amazon send me 2 by mistake (charging me for 2) on one of wich the noncontact curent detector wasn't working. But I was going to return one of them aniway! Got delivered fast as usual!
customer_reviews.author: dimi

customer_reviews.title: Nice clamp meter
customer_reviews.text: I've spent years getting by with only probe meters but kept finding a need for a clamp meter. I was looking for a true RMS meter and settled on this one. I've used it many times since buying it and it works very well. Not much to add regarding the details that other reviewers haven't already covered. For measuring current of household devices, make sure you get anor similar device. Extech products have been good for me.
customer_reviews.author: srs06

customer_reviews.title: I loved this meter
customer_reviews.text: I loved this meter, which survived numerous drops onto hard surfaces, without malfunctioning. However, the SELECTOR SWITCH moves very easily, which is not a good thing, because the OHMS setting is adjacent to the VOLTAGE setting. After accidentally moving the switch too far, 480 VAC caused the meter to read inaccurately, with other functions. I replaced it with an Amprobe-220, which malfunctioned after falling once, from 5ft. onto concrete; cheap meter! Went back to Extech, purchasing the EX655; which is the updated version of the MA640.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: Electrician with 14 years experience.
customer_reviews.text: This meter is good a little slow but no big deal. My problem is the default setting for voltage is DC. I have to hit the mode button to get it to switch to. AC. In my experienced opinion it should be AC as default. Read as accurate as my Fluke. I do the the microfaret reader for checking capacitors.
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: The only down side is the dial is a little ...
customer_reviews.text: The only down side is the dial is a little hard to turn. I am sure this will break in with more use.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Tucker

ata Hold and MIN/MAX, Auto Power Off
